title: Drawing, "A Winged Victory in the Left Spandrel of an Arch", ca. 1805
title_raw: A Winged Victory in the Left Spandrel of an Arch
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite, brush and wash on paper
markings: In purple ink, upper left: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c); watermark: an escutcheon in the scheme of Churchill 322; below C & I HONIG
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Left half; a triangle with a Nike holding in her outer hand a bar with a trophy, and in her inner hand a wreath. The outlines of the arch and of the case, and the keystone are sketched. Inscribed in black chalk: “fama del arco”.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "A Winged Victory in the Left Spandrel of an Arch", ca. 1805. Pen and black ink, graphite, brush and wash on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1356.
